utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is getting ready for her first day.]

utterances.transcript: Okay. Hey. Umm. Does everybody hate these shoes?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (running in from her bedroom, wearing only a towel) Okay. Hey. Umm. Does everybody hate these shoes?

utterances.transcript: Oh yeah, but don't worry. I don't think anybody's gonna focus on that as long as your wearing that towel dress.
Tell him.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Ross) Tell him.

utterances.transcript: It's her first day at this new job. Your not supposed to start with her!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Chandler) It's her first day at this new job. Your not supposed to start with her!

utterances.transcript: All right, I suppose I can wait a day. Hey, what are you doing Friday?
Why?
I need you to come to this bachelor party for my weird cousin Albert, y'know he's the botanist.
Oh God. Y'know, botanists are such geeks.
Yeah. Is that a dinosaur tie?
Hmm? Oh, yeah.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hmm? Oh, yeah. (he makes a growling sound)

utterances.transcript: Morning. Rach, I'm here with the purses!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering, with about 20 purses hanging around her neck) Morning. Rach, I'm here with the purses!

utterances.transcript: It must take you forever to find your keys.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Phoebe) It must take you forever to find your keys.

utterances.transcript: Thank you, thank you, thank you, Pheebs.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (running into the living room) Thank you, thank you, thank you, Pheebs.

utterances.transcript: Your welcome, oh please not the one with the turtles.
No, no, no, no turtles scare me. I don't need that today.
Honey, just relax, it's gonna be fine. Hey, umm,. why don't I come down there and I'll take you out to lunch?
Oh honey, thank you, but Mark's taking me out.
Mark is that ah, the same Mark that helped you get the job?
Yeah, it's kinda like a 'good luck on your first day' sort of thing. Is this actually a lunchbox?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, it's kinda like a 'good luck on your first day' sort of thing. (to Phoebe) Is this actually a lunchbox?

utterances.transcript: Umm, no, it's a purse. And there's a thermos in it.
Oh.
Hey, so can you make it on Friday?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Ross) Hey, so can you make it on Friday?

utterances.transcript: What? Oh yeah, yeah I think so. Why am I invited to this again?
Well apparently Albert has no friends. He's very excited about the bachelor party though. I think actually the only reason he's getting married is so he can see a stripper.
A stripper at a bachelor party, that is so clich. Why don't you get a magician?!
Well, if the magician can open my beer with his but cheeks, then all right.

utterances.transcript: All right, I just got changed in thirty seconds so you can be alone with him. You'd better go for it.

utterances.transcript: Please, I'm not going for anything.
Well, if you don't, I will.
Would you please go?

Adios.

utterances.transcript: Look Julio, someone left their book here.
Ah actually, that is mine.

Flowers of Evil, by Beaudalire. Have you read it?

Your a poet and don't know it.

utterances.transcript: Actually I ah, I am a poet.
Oh, then you do know it. So um what kind of things do you write about?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, then you do know it. (pause) So um what kind of things do you write about?

utterances.transcript: Things that move me. The, the shadow of a tree, a child laughing, or this lip.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Things that move me. The, the shadow of a tree, a child laughing, or this lip. (points to her lip)

utterances.transcript: Mine? Right here?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Mine? (points to her lower lip) Right here?

utterances.transcript: I can write an epic poem about this lip.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I can write an epic poem about this lip. (grabs her lower lip)

utterances.transcript: How would that go? Well, it didn't rhyme, but I liked it.
utterances.transcript_with_note: How would that go? (they kiss) Well, it didn't rhyme, but I liked it.

utterances.transcript: Mark's a genius!
Why?! How?! How is he a genius?
Look, don't you see what's happening here. Instead of hitting on her right away, he's becoming her confidant. Now he's gonna be the guy she goes too to complain about you.
What am I going to do?
Well, why don't you send her a musical bug, op, no you already did that. All right look, you're going to have to go there yourself now, okay, make a few surprise visits.
I don't know you guys.

All right fine, don't do anything, just sit here and talk to us, meanwhile she is talking to him about you. And he's being Mr. Joe Sensitive, and she starts thinking 'Maybe this is the guy for me, because he understands me.'

And before you know it, she's with him. And you'll be all, 'Ohh, man!' And he'll be all, 'Yes!' And us, we'll be like, 'Wh-whoa, dude.' And pretty soon you'll be like, 'Hhiii,' and, and, and, 'I can't go, Rachel and Mark might be there.' And we'll be like, 'Man get over it, it's been four years!!'

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Joey's dance audition, Joey is warming up.]

utterances.transcript: Ah Joey. Joey Tribbiani. Listen Joey, I got a problem, I just got a call from my dance captain, he's having a relationship crisis and can't get out of Long Island.
So, does that mean the audition is off?
Listen Joey, seeing as you've got the most experience, I want you to take these dancers and show them the combination.
What?!
Aw come on Joey, it's easy. Y'know, it's hand, hand, head, head, up, pas de bouree, pas de bouree, big turn here, grand sissone, sissone, sissone, slide back, step, step, step, and jazz hands!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Aw come on Joey, it's easy. Y'know, it's hand, hand, head, head, (very quickly, Joey watches stunned) up, pas de bouree, pas de bouree, big turn here, grand sissone, sissone, sissone, slide back, step, step, step, and jazz hands!

utterances.transcript: It's ah, step-ity, step and jazz hands.
Have fun.
Bye.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Bye. (does the jazz hands)

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The Moondance Diner.]

utterances.transcript: So! I'm just an empty vase, huh?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (to Julio) So! I'm just an empty vase, huh?

utterances.transcript: What?

Y'know, so I don't read as many important books as you do, and I don't write trick poems that seem to be about one thing but are actually about something else. And y'know what, I get excited about stupid stuff, like when I my People magazine comes on Saturday, and the new Hold Everything catalog. Y'know but that does not mean that I'm empty, I care about things. I care about my friends and family. You have no right to make that kind of judgment about me.
Whoa, whoa, whoa.
You don't even know me...
Whoa, whoa, whoa, the poem is not about you.
What?
The Empty Vase is not about you. My baby, you make me so sad that you would think this.
I'm sorry, my friend Phoebe...
No, it's about all women. Well, all American women. You feel better now?
Oh yeah.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sarcastically) Oh yeah.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Rachel are there.]

utterances.transcript: So ah, did you have fun at the bachelor party last night?
Oh yeah, yeah! Look what I got, look what I got. See, she's fully dressed, right?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh yeah, yeah! Look what I got, look what I got. (holds up a pen) See, she's fully dressed, right?

utterances.transcript: Right.

And then you click it and, uh-oh, she's naked. And then, and then you click it again and she's dressed. She's a business woman, she's walking down the street, she's window shopping, and whoa-whoa-whoa, sh-she's naked!
utterances.transcript_with_note: And then you click it and, uh-oh, she's naked. And then, and then you click it again and she's dressed. She's a business woman, she's walking down the street, she's window shopping, and (clicks pen) whoa-whoa-whoa, sh-she's naked! (Rachel just stares at him.)

utterances.transcript: Hi.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Hi.

utterances.transcript: Hello.
Y'know what, I'm, I'm gonna spend some alone time with the pen.
I'm sorry, I was an idiot.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sits down next to her) I'm sorry, I was an idiot.

utterances.transcript: A big idiot.
A big idiot. Just you have to realize is, this whole Mark thing is kinda hard for me.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Gunther is eavesdropping in the background.)

utterances.transcript: Honey, why is it hard, I mean we've been together for almost a year now?

Well, I was with Carol for like eight years and I lost her. And now if it's possible I think I love you even more. So, it's hard for me to believe that I'm not gonna, well that someone else is not going to take you away.
Let it be me! Let it be me!
Honey, that's very sweet, it just seems to me though, that if two people love each other and trust each other, like we do, there's no reason to be jealous.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Honey, that's very sweet, it just seems to me though, that if two people love each other and trust each other, like we do, there's no reason to be jealous. (she kisses him)

utterances.transcript: I gotta get going. Bye Chandler.
Oh, okay Ross. Listen, this pen is kinda getting boring, so can you pick me up some porn?

Man, I gotta get a kid.

Oh.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh. (starts shaking the sugar down in a packet really hard.)

utterances.transcript: Is there a Julio here?
